questions.question: What is the primary purpose of chunking in natural language processing?

answers.a: To count the number of words in a sentence
answers.b: To identify and group syntactically related words into phrases
answers.c: To translate sentences between different languages
answers.d: To correct grammatical errors in text

explanations.a: Incorrect. Word counting is a simple task that doesn't require chunking analysis.
explanations.b: Correct! Chunking identifies syntactically related words and groups them into meaningful phrases like noun phrases and verb phrases.
explanations.c: Incorrect. While chunking can help in translation, it's not the primary purpose of chunking itself.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Grammar correction is a different NLP task, though chunking can provide useful information for it.

questions.question: In the IOB tagging scheme, what does the 'B-' prefix represent?

answers.b: A word that belongs to multiple chunks
answers.c: The beginning of a new chunk
answers.d: A word that doesn't belong to any chunk

explanations.a: Incorrect. There is no specific tag for the end of chunks in IOB scheme; chunk boundaries are implicit.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Words cannot belong to multiple chunks simultaneously in the IOB scheme.
explanations.c: Correct! The 'B-' prefix indicates the beginning or start of a new chunk.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Words that don't belong to any chunk are marked with 'O' (Outside).

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common chunk type in English?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Noun Phrase (NP) is one of the most common chunk types in English.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Verb Phrase (VP) is a fundamental chunk type containing verbs and auxiliaries.
explanations.c: Correct! 'Sentence Phrase (SP)' is not a recognized chunk type. Chunks represent sub-sentential phrases.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Prepositional Phrase (PP) is a standard chunk type in English.

questions.question: In the sentence 'The big red car', how should this phrase be chunked?

answers.b: [The big red car] - as a single noun phrase
answers.c: [The big] [red car] - as two separate chunks
answers.d: [The] [big red car] - determiner separate from the rest

explanations.a: Incorrect. These words are syntactically related and should be grouped together.
explanations.b: Correct! 'The big red car' forms a single noun phrase (NP) with determiner + adjectives + noun.
explanations.c: Incorrect. All these words modify and relate to the same noun and should be in one chunk.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The determiner 'the' is part of the noun phrase it introduces.

questions.question: What is the main difference between chunking and full syntactic parsing?

answers.a: Chunking is faster but provides less detailed structural information
answers.b: Chunking only works with English, while parsing works with all languages
answers.c: Chunking is more accurate than full parsing
answers.d: There is no difference between chunking and parsing

explanations.a: Correct! Chunking provides shallow parsing with basic phrase identification, while full parsing creates complete syntactic trees.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Chunking works with multiple languages, including Hindi and other Indian languages.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Parsing provides more detailed analysis, though chunking can be more robust for certain applications.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Chunking and parsing are different levels of syntactic analysis.

questions.question: In Hindi chunking, what is the key difference from English regarding prepositions/postpositions?

answers.a: Hindi doesn't use any positional markers
answers.b: Hindi postpositions are included within the noun phrase chunk
answers.c: Hindi prepositions work exactly like English prepositions
answers.d: Hindi uses only prepositions, never postpositions

explanations.a: Incorrect. Hindi uses postpositions extensively to mark grammatical relationships.
explanations.b: Correct! In Hindi, postpositions like 'में' (in) are included as part of the noun phrase chunk.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Hindi primarily uses postpositions, which behave differently from English prepositions in chunking.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Hindi is a postpositional language, using postpositions rather than prepositions.

questions.question: Which of the following best represents the IOB tagging for the phrase 'will be running'?

explanations.a: Correct! This represents a single verb phrase chunk with 'will' beginning it and 'be' and 'running' continuing it.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Using B-VP for each word would indicate three separate verb phrase chunks.
explanations.c: Incorrect. These words form a coherent verb phrase and shouldn't be marked as outside chunks.
explanations.d: Incorrect. A chunk cannot start with I-VP; it must begin with B-VP.

questions.question: What is the primary challenge in automatic chunking systems?

answers.b: Resolving attachment ambiguities and boundary decisions

explanations.a: Incorrect. Vocabulary coverage is typically not the main limitation in chunking systems.
explanations.b: Correct! Determining where chunks begin and end, and resolving ambiguous attachments (like prepositional phrase attachment) are major challenges.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Text-to-speech is a different NLP task unrelated to chunking challenges.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Translation is a separate task, though chunking can assist in translation systems.

questions.question: In evaluating chunking performance, what does the F1-score measure?

answers.a: Only the precision of chunk boundary identification
answers.b: Only the recall of chunk boundary identification
answers.c: The harmonic mean of precision and recall
answers.d: The total number of correctly identified chunks

explanations.a: Incorrect. F1-score considers both precision and recall, not just precision alone.
explanations.b: Incorrect. F1-score considers both precision and recall, not just recall alone.
explanations.c: Correct! F1-score is the harmonic mean of precision and recall, providing a balanced measure of chunking performance.
explanations.d: Incorrect. While related to accuracy, F1-score specifically measures the balance between precision and recall.
